Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Abandoned

Abandon squashing this into https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/75390
This code has dependency to `https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/70728`, please review the commit first.

Can we support checking whether the endpoint support PLDM Firmware Update type and Fru commands before call?
In the current implementation, the `discoverFDs` is always called regardless the terminus support Firmware Update type or not.

About this commit, `QueryDownstreamDevices` is optional command as table `Table 16 – PLDM for Firmware Update Command Codes` in DSP0267 1.3.0. It is better to check the supported status of terminus for this type of command before calling.

In my knowledge, the only way to check if the terminus supports the command is sending the command to it and check the CC it returned (please let me know if I was wrong). So I directly return the response if the CC was `PLDM_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PLDM_CMD`.

Please see the highlight comment I left with word "Here".

Hi, thanks for the review first.

Do you mean it should check the supportness for the two types by send command `GetPLDMTypes` in PLDM base spec?

Also, it seems that the inventory_manager would not send any commands in PLDM for Fru spec (DSP0257), could you please let me know why we should check the supportness of Fru commands in here?

The PLDM Base command GetPLDMTypes and GetPLDMCommands can be used to identify the supported PLDM types and supported PLDM commands supported by terminus.
Those commands are mandatory so we can always know if the terminus support PLDM Fw update or not.
With that we don't need to send the fw commands if the terminus does not support the commands.

> Hi, thanks for the review first.
> 
> Do you mean it should check the supportness for the two types by send command `GetPLDMTypes` in PLDM base spec?

Yes. `GetPLDMTypes` and `GetPLDMCommands`, you can check these code https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/3166ef23d9ffdc47d09afcea68d7a934c61a9f6c/platform-mc/terminus_manager.cpp#L303
> 
> Also, it seems that the inventory_manager would not send any commands in PLDM for Fru spec (DSP0257), could you please let me know why we should check the supportness of Fru commands in here?
Here
Something that I hope to eventually address is removing the need to allocate an EID in order to serialise the request...

Hello, thanks again for your review and sorry for the late reply, agree with your point and I believe allocating EIDs here is just a short term solution.

I've received all your request, it will be revise in a few days...
Please use placement-new rather than `reinterpret_cast<>()`. Can you work through the rest of the patch to apply this suggestion where it's applicable?
Got it, will be fixed soon in the next patchset.

I really prefer this parsing be implemented in libpldm. You should not be casting this type over a buffer pointer, as it invokes undefined behaviour and potentially generates unaligned loads. You also haven't validated that the number of downstream devices and the associated variable length data correlates to the size of the buffer, which will all be handled by an implementation in libpldm.
Got it, I'll check if there is a sutiable parser in libpldm, if not, these implementation will be migrated.

This patch has been merged with adjcent [70732] to [75390], due to highly related feature development, all of the reviewer's mentions has been applied to the new patch.

[70732]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/70732
[75390]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/75390
